content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'accepte la contribution parce que c'est un super algorithme, assez facile a résoudre et sympa à faire.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: J'accepte cette contribution parce que les jeux de test sont bien passés.

The statement is not very clear, it could use an example. The largest test case (77) should be a test and not a validator so it's less likely that someone times out / runs into stack overflow or integer overflow on a validator after getting 100% from the visible tests. A couple more test cases wouldn't hurt (especially small ones that players can think through in their head, since currently the smallest visible one is 7 which is pretty difficult already).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: this can be solved in less than 5 minutes.

Please change in the stub-generator the variable name to n (read input:int --> read n:int).

And, what is the starting number of pairs?

Goal section
* Please mention the initial number of pairs of rabbits.

Input section
* Please mention that n is an integer.

Constraints section
* Please state the range of possible values of n.

Stub generator
* Please write in English only.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar. Having a validator but not a test where n is a large number will be a nasty surprise to the players, e.g. a player may use an integer variable instead of a long variable in their code, and passes all the tests, but suddenly finds that their code fails the validator because of an overflow problem. That is highly undesirable.

Thanks.

I see that you haven't followed up all my comments yet. Here's a recap and some new comments:

Goal section
* Please mention the initial number of pairs of rabbits (also mentioned again by @jddingemanse).

Input section
* Please change "Ligne" to "Line".

Constraints section
* Please format n as a [[variable]].

Stub generator
* Please state "write answer" (or some other appropriate word(s)) instead of "write n".

Cases
* Please change the input of Test 4 to a large number, comparable to Validator 2.

Thanks.

I think all errors are fixed !
Thanks for your help @5DN1L

Thank you too.

Please move "We have 01 pair of rabbits at the beginning" to Goal section. It is not a constraint; it is part of the specification of the problem.

In the stub generator, please delete the extra "write" (you need one "write" only).
